string-array.name: insects_description_txt
string-array.item: The Monarch Butterfly (Danaus plexippus) is a milkweed butterfly and the most familiar North American butterfly.
The Mourning Cloak Butterfly (Nymphalis antiopa) is a butterfly native to Eurasia and North America.
The Painted Lady Butterfly (Vanessa cardui) is a colorful widespread butterfly.
The Pipevine Swallowtail (Battus philenor) is a swallowtail butterfly distributed throughout the forests of North America and Central America.
The Red Admiral Butterfly (Vanessa atalanta) is a butterfly that is widely distributed across the temperate regions of North Africa.
Dome shaped (convex) on top, flat on the bottom, and rounded when viewed from above.
Red and black in coloration and, like all insects, they are protected by a hard exoskeleton and have six legs.
Usually brown with a banded dull yellow and brown abdomen.
They have 2 compound eyes, antennae, a proboscis, 6 legs, and wings covered with scales.
The adult brown marmorated stink bug is shield shaped with brown mottling.
The orchid mantis is a species of praying mantis that models itself after a flower, specifically a pink orchid.
